    Default was listed as a secondary outcome in both the trial registry record and in the methods section of the article.

    Low risk of bias in all categories.

    Low risk of bias arising from timing of identification and recruitment of participants: Training of screeners were performed after randomisation. Screening and identification were performed after training.

    Subgroup 1.14.2 Non‐RCTs

    Alvarez Moran 2018

    There was only one cluster in each arm (Kita West and Kita East). Baseline characteristics and baseline outcomes differed between groups.

    Participants and personnel were not blinded but this may not have influenced the effectiveness of the treatment.

    Data was not available for 82/699 (11.7%) of participants in the intervention arm and for 23/235 participants (9.8%) in the control arm

    Outcome assessors were interventionists but there is no evidence that this influenced the outcome assessment. Defined as missed two consecutive appoinments (14 days).

    Primary outcome in trial registry record.

    High risk of bias arising from the randomization process.

    Charle‐Cuellar 2021

    This was a non‐randomized trial. Baseline characteristics differed between groups.

    Participants and personnel were not blinded but this may not have influenced the effectiveness of the treatment.

    Outcomes were unknown for 42 children (16.7% of those admitted) in the control group and 122 (19.7%) in the intervention group.

    Outcome assessors were interventionists but there is no evidence that this influenced the outcome assessment. Defined as absent for two folow‐up visits.

    Secondary outcome of the study.

    High risk of bias arising from randomization process and due to missing outcome data.

    Linneman 2007

    Non‐randomized trial.

    Participants and personnel were not blinded but this may not have influenced the effectiveness of the treatment.

    All patients were accounted for in outcome analysis.

    Outcome assessors were interventionists but there is no evidence that this influenced the outcome assessment. Defined as missed two follow‐up visits.

    Planned in methods section.

    High risk of bias arising from randomization process.

    Ogobara Dougnon 2021

    Non‐randomized trial. Baseline characteristics and outcomes differed between groups.

    Participants and personnel were not blinded but this may not have influenced the effectiveness of the treatment.

    2.2% of participants in intervention arm and none in the comparison arm had missing outcome data.

    Outcome assessors were interventionists but there is no evidence that this influenced the outcome assessment. Default was defined as "when the child was absent in two consecutive visits".

    Planned outcome.

    High risk of bias arising from randomization process.

    Wilunda 2021

    Non‐randomized trial. Baseline characteristics differed between groups.

    Participants and personnel were not blinded but this may not have influenced the effectiveness of the treatment.

    3.9% in control group had missing outcome data.

    Outcome assessors were interventionists but there is no evidence that this influenced the outcome assessment. Defined as absence on three consecutive visits

    Planned outcome.

    High risk of bias arising from randomization process.
    Figures and Tables -

    Subgroup 1.15.1 Non‐RCTs

    Alvarez Moran 2018

    There was only one cluster in each arm (Kita West and Kita East). Baseline characteristics and baseline outcomes differed between groups.

    Participants and personnel were not blinded but this may not have influenced the effectiveness of the treatment.

    1 patient each unaccounted for in intervention group and control group.

    Outcome assessors were interventionists but there is no evidence that this influenced the outcome assessment.

    Not listed as an outcome in the methods section.

    HIgh risk of bias arising from the randomization process.

    Charle‐Cuellar 2021

    This was a non‐randomized trial. Baseline characteristics differed between groups.

    Participants and personnel were not blinded but this may not have influenced the effectiveness of the treatment.

    Outcomes were unknown for 42 children (16.7% of those admitted) in the control group and 122 (19.7%) in the intervention group

    Outcome assessors were interventionists but there is no evidence that this influenced the outcome assessment.

    Not listed as an outcome in the methods section.

    High risk of bis arising from the randomization process and due to missing outcome data.

    Ogobara Dougnon 2021

    Non‐randomized trial. Baseline characteristics and outcomes differed between groups.

    Participants and personnel were not blinded but this may not have influenced the effectiveness of the treatment.

    2.2% of participants in the intervention arm had missing outcome data.

    Outcome assessors were interventionists but there is no evidence that this influenced the outcome assessment.

    Outcome was not defined.

    High risk of bias arising from randomization process and in selection of the reported result.
